p:
R. rosea, W. somnifera, and E. senticosus downregulate the expression of key genes ( ALOX5AP, DPEP2, LTC4S) involved in the biosynthesis of leukotrienes A, B, C, D, and E, resulting in inhibition of the leukotriene signaling pathway suggesting their potential benefits in Alzheimer's disease (FigureÂ 7).
